channel.title: Engadget
channel.description: Engadget is a web magazine with obsessive daily coverage of everything new in gadgets and consumer electronics
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: US blacklists Chinese supercomputer organizations over military support
item.description: The US Commerce Department has put seven Chinese supercomputer organizations on its Entity List for contributing to China's military.

item.title: Record professional audio on your phone with this $139 mic
item.description: Professional audio equipment can be expensive, but this pocket-sized AudioWow mic offers useful features like noise reduction, phone call recording and speech recognition at an affordable price.

item.title: Arcane delays 'Deathloop' until September 14th
item.description: The hotly anticipated first-person shooter was supposed to hit PS5 and PC on May 21st.

item.title: Apple and Epic lay out strategies for their upcoming court battle
item.description: Apple and Epic have outlined their arguments in a lawsuit over App Store policies and competition.

item.title: HMD revamps its Nokia smartphone lineup with six new affordable models
item.description: HMD first made a name for itself by remaking a classic feature phone â€” and triggering an avalanche of hype in the process. The Finnish company has been dutifully churning out Nokia-branded smartphones ever since, but during an online launch event today, HMD was eager to prove that it's been up to more than business as usual. For one, those numbers-only model names are gone, replaced by three new smartphone ranges: the X, G, and C series. And to make getting connected even easier, the company is making an end-run around its usual carrier partners by lighting up an HMD-branded MVNO in the UK with a global roll-out to follow.

item.title: The best baby monitors for your home nursery
item.description: Here's a list of the best baby monitors for your home nursery, as reviewed by Engadget editors.

item.title: 'Halo: Master Chief Collection' now supports keyboard and mouse on Xbox
item.description: Halo: Master Chief Collection (MCC) Season 6 has arrived for Xbox and PC and a new patch has enabled a much anticipated feature on Xbox: mouse and keyboard support.

item.title: Lenovo's new gaming phone has a 720Hz touch response rate
item.description: Lenovo's Legion Phone Duel 2, the follow-up to its first gaming handset, features eight virtual controls including four ultrasonic shoulder keys.

item.title: MacBook and iPad production could face delays due to global chip shortage
item.description: Apple has delayed the production of some MacBook and iPad models due to the global chip shortage affecting the electronics and automotive industries, according to Nikkei Asia.

item.title: The Morning After: The best wireless headphones you can find
item.description: We're lining up the best wireless headphones we can find, and looking at Best Buy's Amazon Prime rival.

item.title: Boston Dynamics' Spot robot tested in combat training with the French army
item.description: Boston Dynamics robotic dog Spot was one of several robots tested by the French army during training sessions at a military school in the northwest of France.

item.title: Facebook test adds contextual 'labels' to popular pages
item.description: Facebook has gradually started applying labels to pages in order to provide more context about their nature as part of a new experiment.

item.title: Facebook's experimental app Hotline is like Clubhouse with video
item.description: Facebook is testing an app called Hotline that shares some of the features of the invitation-only audio chat room app Clubhouse, but allows speakers, or creators to appear on video.

item.title: Best Buy's $200 Amazon Prime rival offers tech support and free installs
item.description: Best Buy has started piloting a $200 membership program meant to rival Amazon Prime and Walmart's own take on a subscription service.

item.title: LG makes a 'three year pledge' on updates for its Android phones
item.description: LG says its premium smartphones will receive up to three Android OS upgrades from the year of purchase.

item.title: The National Archives won't be able to host Donald Trump's tweets on Twitter
item.description: Twitter won't allow the National Archives to host an archive of Trump's tweets on the social media network.

item.title: Tesla refunded customers who were charged twice for their cars
item.description: The Tesla customers who were charged twice for their EVs did get their money back, eventually.

item.title: MST3K's latest kickstarter is funding a new streaming platform
item.description: Mystery Science Theater 3000 returns to Kickstarter to fund its latest comeback, with greater aspirations this time around.

item.title: Twitch will ban users for serious offline misconduct
item.description: An expanded safety policy targets major safety risks to the Twitch community that emerge offline or on other platforms.

item.title: TikTok is adding six new interactive, musical filters
item.description: Starting today, TikTok is rolling out new music-themed filters that promise greater interactivity.

item.title: Eufy's two-camera baby monitor kit is $50 off again at Amazon
item.description: Eufy's popular baby monitor kit is back down to its lowest price

item.title: Apple's Find My app officially works with non-Apple devices
item.description: Apple is expanding its Find My network to include third-party devices.

item.title: Google's virtual I/O developer conference kicks off on May 18
item.description: The show will kick off May 18 and will be hosted online only, as we continue to wait out the end of the pandemic. It will also be free to attend.

item.title: Spotify rolls out its own hands-free voice assistant on iOS and Android
item.description: You can ask the app to play a song, artist or playlist after saying 'Hey, Spotify.'

item.title: YouTube is once again the most popular social media platform
item.description: Facebook and YouTube are still the most dominant social media platforms in the United States, but only YouTube is still growing.
